sentences.english: Localised epidemics and global pandemics periodically pose a significant national and global threat.
sentences.chinese: 局部和全球的的流行病时不时的威胁着我们。

sentences.english: He was like a taut string; you can play the notes from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一根绷紧的弦，时不时可以弹奏出音符。

sentences.english: He was utterly rigid except for his hands, which were opening and closing spasmodically.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他完全僵硬了，除了手掌时不时一开一合。

sentences.english: He punctuated his remarks with thumps on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他讲话时不时地捶着桌子。

sentences.english: A few children buy game currency from time to time in devoted machine.
sentences.chinese: 一些孩子时不时地买来游戏币投入机器中。

sentences.english: Even birds like to spend time alone and will run away from their nest sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 即使是鸟也喜欢独处，而且时不时地会离开自己的巢。

sentences.english: Every now and then, one of us goes to the kitchen to make coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩人说不定是谁，时不时去厨房沏杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Being aware, moment-by-moment, of what you are feeling.
sentences.chinese: 时不时的注意自己的情绪。

sentences.english: From time to time, Putin likes to use a dirty word or utter an obscene threat.
sentences.chinese: 时不时地，普京喜欢用脏字或者突然说出下作的恐吓。

sentences.english: Why do things at times have to be so back breaking and soul wrenching ?
sentences.chinese: 为什么事情时不时地就会让你身心交瘁呢？

sentences.english: My neighbor would drop in on me from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 邻居们时不时到我家串串门。

sentences.english: After all, who doesn't whizz round blind corners on the wrong side of the road from time to time?
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，谁不会时不时地在盲角疾驰着打个回转弯呢？
瞪羚在奔跑时不时地齐足跳行。

sentences.english: Trapse downstairs in your underthings to check it out?
sentences.chinese: 还是时不时穿着内衣到楼下看看。

sentences.english: Everyone enjoys a game of make-believe now and then.
sentences.chinese: 所有人时不时喜欢搞些扮装游戏。

sentences.english: I may listen to music from time to time, but often enjoy the silence.
sentences.chinese: 我可能时不时的听听音乐，但我通常享受那种安静。

definition: from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
see 隔三差五|隔三差五[ge2 san1 cha4 wu3]
(do sth) in passing/incidentally (while doing sth else)
